0.author: Bill Wuxton
0.content: After an exciting battle to the finish, Void held off the competition to take another win in his impressive 2019 GTE season.
0.title: Void takes the win at Indy

1.author: Bill Wuxton
1.content: An attrition heavy race at Watkins Glen saw driver after driver disconnect. Through the carnage, Lieutenant Dan drove his Ferrari 488 to victory, claiming another win in his 2019 season. DC5R and Jean Sibelius rounded out the podium positions. Not all the DNFs were unaviodable. Notably, after a celebrated qualifying performance, Malgho "New Guy" TV disconnected when a team member reset his engine while battling for the lead.
1.title: Dan wins at The Glen

2.author: Bill Wuxton
2.content: Later this month the Just 2 Idiots Cup Series will be revealing the proposed rules for the 2020 season. The rules have been the subject of heavy speculation, with rumors including a possible class change, format shakeups, and even a new Antarctica round of the championship. It can be safely assumed that the annual Bong Beach 420 will safely be back on the schedule, and that we will see a single-class series, after the confusion at the top of the 2019 championship table.
2.title: 2020 Rules to be Revealed

3.author: Bill Wuxton
3.content: The Just 2 Idiots Cup is taking the show to Texas this week, where the field will contend with the second oval this year. Many drivers from up and down the grid expect to have competitive weekends, while you can never count out the championship leaders. Void and DC5R will be especially keen to continue their battle which saw them fight to the checkered flag last time the series ran an oval, at Monza.
3.title: J2ICS To Get Rowdy at Texas

-LnJCr2xhjusYZEQQ_3e.author: Secret Spy
-LnJCr2xhjusYZEQQ_3e.content: Tonight is the night for J2I to run at Texas. As the drivers prepare, all eyes are at the top of the leaderboard, as Lieutenant Dan looks to hold off berries? in the final races of the season. Further down the field R-Tupps may be set to pick up position as erco may be unable to start the race. Ovals always produce yellow flags, strange pit stop strategies and lots of action, so look for a mixed up grid and lots of lead changes. Keep an eye out for a surprise podium finish from some of the oval specialists, and strong finishes from DC5R and Void after their last tangle at Monza. Who knows how things will wrap up?
-LnJCr2xhjusYZEQQ_3e.title: Race Day at Texas

-LnNx6dta1Cls5vz-Ex6.author: Bill Wuxton
-LnNx6dta1Cls5vz-Ex6.content: The J2I Cup Series completed 100 of the scheduled 151 laps at Texas Motor Speedway Tuesday night, in an incident filled race which saw the championship leader, Lieutenant Dan, disqualified for a pit lane violation early. More surprising was the second pit lane DQ, erco. Series viewers were treated to a unique finishing order as well. Oval specialists R-Tupps, Water Cooler Dale and Dewey Ryder all had solid runs, in and around the lead. In the end, the Corvette of Jean Sibelius took the win, with Dale and Dewey rounding out the podium. The race saw the same high disconnect rate and inconsistent technical performance that have plagued recent rounds of the championship. This leaves the J2ICS in a difficult position, as there are rumors of alternative series scheduling with only a few months before the 2020 season. Will Texas prove the nail in the Project Cars 2 coffin, and a windfall for iRacing or Assetto Corsa? Stay tuned as the series heads to Laguna Seca for the penultimate round, in early September.
-LnNx6dta1Cls5vz-Ex6.title: Texas Serves up Speed and Controversy

-LnzPdKwY-AovGhjEaeZ.author: Vince Belch
-LnzPdKwY-AovGhjEaeZ.content:
The haulers have just rolled in for the second to last race of the season at Mazda Raceway Laguna Seca.  Word in the paddock for Thursday night's race is that Lieutenant Dan has some new setup tricks up his sleeve after running some sim laps, while Jean Sibelius, who trails by 19 points, is hungry for another win.

"Yeah we have a strong race car this week and I think we've gotta shot at getting Dan" he said. Before reporters could speak with other drivers Sibelius made sure to announce "Egmelt has been really good for us this season getting us to where we are.  Let's dispel the rumors now, even with the possible game switch coming up, Egmelt is here to stay."  

While it has yet to be officially confirmed if the J2ICS will switch over to iRacing from Project Cars 2 next season, it's on everyone's mind.  Will sponsors change or stay the same?  Same cars or different?  We can only speculate right now. 

Further back in the field, Water Cooler Dale still has a shot at surpassing Dewey Ryder in the points. 

Dewey Ryder shared his dismay for Dale in the previous race. "Yeah, if he's gonna run me hard like that, I'm gonna kick his #$#@ on the track."  Water Cooler Dale could not be reached for comment. 

Erco also has a chance to take back seventh place from R-Tupps.  R-Tupps only comment was "YEE YEE, WE GOT THIS!"

-This is a developing story.
-LnzPdKwY-AovGhjEaeZ.title: Laguna the Seca (Hakuna the Tata)

-Lo6JrgR_vuCKS3o5d9O.author: Bill Wuxton
-Lo6JrgR_vuCKS3o5d9O.content: It was an exercise in mathematics at Laguna Seca. With only the double-points round at the Nürburgring remaining on the calendar, Lieutenant Dan only needed to finish 20 points ahead of championship rival Jean Sibelius. And open the gap he did. A commanding drive saw Dan finish in 2nd place, first across the line, but classified behind disconnected race winner Void, after the sportsmanship regulations were applied. Sibelius has a race of mixed fortunes, a safe opening stint, spins from DC5R and a fuel failure from erco saw Sibelius running in 3rd, within sight of Dan in the first stint. His pace dropped as his tires aged, and by the second stint, Sibelius dropped into a battle with a charging DC5R and beastGP. A phenomenal pit entry incident saw both Jean and DC5R switch to 2 stop strategies, which had the end result of dropping Jean to a finish in 5th, behind both DC5R and beastGP. Futher down the field R-Tupps struggled with the dusty track conditions, Water Cooler Dale continued his quest to catch Dewey Ryder, and Zebrazzz saw out a frustrating race in his return to GTE racing this year. Ahead of it all, the Ferrari 488 of Lieutenant Dan did everything required to sew up the 2019 Championship. A year of consistent finsihes, and a signature win at Le Mans has been rewarded with J2I's ultimate prize. The series will move on to the final race, the Crown Jewel of the Black Forest at the Nürburgring.
-Lo6JrgR_vuCKS3o5d9O.title: Lieutenant Dan Wins 2019 J2I Cup

-Lo7tyxZGHJdw5u2V7au.author: Vince Belch
-Lo7tyxZGHJdw5u2V7au.content:
Today, J2ICS has just announced its partnership with Egmelt as the title sponsor for next season.  While other companies were vying for this coveted spot, Egmelt won out with the major money move.  Today, we also learned that Egmelt will continue to sponsor the car of Jean Sibelius, who is rumored to be switching back to BMW. 

Egmelt has been seen on the pit boards of multiple series, (shown above with GT3) and started exploring more sponsorship opportunities mid-season with J2ICS. 

J2ICS released this statement saying, "we are excited to have Egmelt aboard as our title sponsor next year and hope to have a fruitful run through the contracted end date.  The growth we have seen this season has been unparalleled to previous seasons and we believe that they will take us to the next level." 

While there is no word on how long the contract lasts, many believe Egmelt is here to stay.
-Lo7tyxZGHJdw5u2V7au.title: Meet the Face of J2ICS

-LoGxRK4RNCirwFBy_dN.author: Vince Belch
-LoGxRK4RNCirwFBy_dN.content: As we head into the final race at Nurburgring this week, the driver's committee and J2ICS management have come to a landmark agreement to switch to iRacing next season!  Much rejoicing was had in the J2ICS garage as the news was announced. The multi-dollar deal struck will bring better competition, less disconnects, more visibility for the league, among many other advancements.  GTE cars are planned to be continued next season and the new schedule is nearing its completion as the driver's finalize their votes on where to take the league in week 14 (specifically.) ----This is a developing story.
-LoGxRK4RNCirwFBy_dN.title: It's Official!

-LoS0fFRvs_Fo36oLMmZ.author: Bill Wuxton
-LoS0fFRvs_Fo36oLMmZ.content: In the final race of the season, there is more on the line than a quick glance at the top of the championship might suggest. While the top three positions are all but nailed down, the double points finale could see a fair bit of movement further down the table. The famed Nurburgring Nordschleife is a track that favors drivers with practice and experience. A famed journalist from England once claimed of the circuit “that it seemed as if a reeling, drunken giant had been sent out to determine the route”. Indeed J2ICS drivers such as DC5R, Critter_Fritters and erco have been putting in as many practice laps as time has allowed, and will be pushing hard for victories. RACERS TO WATCH: Void is a single point behind DC5R, and with double points on offer, it's winner-takes-fourth in the championship. After disappointment in California, erco is 8 points adrift of R-Tupps, but in the twisting vales of the Eifel Mountains, anything could happen, and a jump to a seventh place overall finish is possible. J2ICS says goodbye to Project Cars 2 tomorrow at the Nurburgring. Who will be there when the final flag falls?
-LoS0fFRvs_Fo36oLMmZ.title: J2ICS Goes to Hell

-LoWhDUAHwSZ_UzbtIG4.author: Secret Spy
-LoWhDUAHwSZ_UzbtIG4.content: Everyone in the paddock has their calculators out for the championship tonight. Here's a break-down of the possible position changes: LT. DAN has already locked up the championship, 22 points ahead of JEAN SIBELIUS who can lose 2nd place to either BERRIES or DC5R, who can take 2nd overall by finishing 6 or more positions ahead of JEAN. If BERRIES doesn't race, DC5R is guaranteed a minimum of 3rd overall. VOID could also climb if he makes the race, as he's a single point behind DC5R. BEASTGP is nearly certain to finish in 6th. If ERCO finishes 4 positions ahead of R-TUPPS, he'll bump in the standings. CRITTER_FRITTERS can jump ERCO by finishing 4 positions ahead of him, as well. WATER COOLER DALE needs 5 cars between himself and DEWEY RYDER to make a leap. With such wide margins, disconnects, massive wrecks, pitstop blunders and bad on-track decisions are the best chance most racers have to make up ground. Whew. That's a lot of math. - S.Spy
-LoWhDUAHwSZ_UzbtIG4.title: Championship Math

-LoYwRO0E05mIpNSpELE.author: Vance B. Walcheiz
-LoYwRO0E05mIpNSpELE.content: After a grueling crown jewel race at the Nurburgring, DC5R takes the victory. The field ended up spreading itself pretty thin through the night portion.  Disconnects, loss of headlights, and on track incidents plagued multiple drivers this evening. More on the race itself later.  Lt. Dan is now officially the 2nd J2ICS champion and will be getting the Egmelt trophy sometime soon. Dan said after this race "We had a hard fought battle this season and you know, maybe R-Tupps could just stop punting that would be helpful." R-Tupps commented during the race that the punts were not his fault, but due to faulty wiring in his car's electronics. iRacing is around the corner as pre-season testing, recruitment, advertisement, and more testing commence.  What new players will sign-on to J2ICS contracts? Who moves up next season and who takes a step back?
-LoYwRO0E05mIpNSpELE.title: Welcome to the off-season

-LqAAG7NSIzl32VRj_WJ.author: Vince Belch
-LqAAG7NSIzl32VRj_WJ.content: The garage area is stirring with the sounds of wrenches, hammers, and motors getting ready for testing for next season.  While no official tests have been announced for the 2020 J2ICS: Presented by Egmelt, teams are taking advantage of their time off by using their time to gain more data for the new season.
-LqAAG7NSIzl32VRj_WJ.title: So What's Next?

-LqTC29c0Sg_Jvk1oJet.author: Vince Belch
-LqTC29c0Sg_Jvk1oJet.content:
J2i has entered a car into Jimmy's Race for Mental Health, a race in which Jimmy Broadbent (prominent iRacing YouTuber) is hosting on iRacing to bring awareness to mental health.  The charity race also marks 300k YouTube subscribers for Broadbent's channel where proceeds will benefit Mind - the Mental Health Charity. For more information on this race and Jimmy's story, check out this link: https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/race-for-mental-health.                                                     The race is slated to being on October 11th, 2019 and conclude 24 hours later on the Zolder Circuit in GT1 cars or the Audi TCR. The J2i team has selected the Audi (pictured above). Teams will need to use multiple drivers, strong strategy and more to take the cup home.  See the likes of J2i stars like Erco, Lieutenant Dan, BeastGP, and more make the 24 hour run.  "All proceeds for the race goes to a wonderful charity and it's great to see the online racing community come together for a good cause" said J2i Commissioner Water Cooler Dale  
Stay tuned for more and even what everything means on the livery!
-LqTC29c0Sg_Jvk1oJet.title: J2i to Race at Zolder for Jimmy's Race for Mental Health

-LqY-Fbnasrt-ZH42zQ0.author: Bruton C. Whitfield
-LqY-Fbnasrt-ZH42zQ0.title: Another Angle of the J2i Car at Zolder (LEAKED)

-Lr6RBXLj9iMpkpU94eF.author: Vinch Belch
-Lr6RBXLj9iMpkpU94eF.content: Around 11:00 AM CST, J2i finished the 24 Hours of Zolder, Race for Mental Health.  A tough battle was fought from the early green flag runs of the race, to the darkness of the Belgium night, to the early dawn.  The team finished in 28th overall and 17th in class. The midnight hours led to some nail biting laps where the team wasn't sure they would make it on SR x. By the end of the race, J2i used nearly all of their 255x allowed.  "We should be proud of the result, we really dug deep to finish" said Erco. "I'm real proud of our J2i EGGMELT Team with the finish.  It wasn't obviously the result we were hoping for, but we made it all the way through our first 24hr race. The guys put in a ton of work to make this race happen and we're already planning future team races even as next season begins" said J2i Commissioner Water Cooler Dale. Also, over 45k dollars were raised for Mind, the charity which this race was supporting.
-Lr6RBXLj9iMpkpU94eF.title: J2i Goes the Distance

-LrliCmgHh7t7J7Xpcwd.author: Vince Belch
-LrliCmgHh7t7J7Xpcwd.content: Water Cooler Dale brought his J2iCS, Hellmann's Mayo, Egmelt NASCAR K&N Chevrolet Impala SS to a 5th place finish at Thompson Speedway this evening.  While he lead a 19 laps, a worn right front gave way to the leaders taking the top spot.  "Wish we could've gotten the win there, but the J2iCS-Hellmann's Mayo, Egmelt car was quick and we qualified 2nd.  Wish we could've taken it all the way, but we had a few scuffles our there.  The boi's gave me a good car today and we'll get 'em next time"  It was the first official iRacing NASCAR race where J2iCS was a primary sponsor on a car and quite a good finish it was.
-LrliCmgHh7t7J7Xpcwd.title: J2iCS Represented at Thompson Speedway

-LsnfxfsQuQPPIHQ2k8X.author: Bobin Biller
-LsnfxfsQuQPPIHQ2k8X.content:
As the Just 2 Idiots Cup Series rolls in to Laguna Seca for the first pre-season test, several rumors are buzzing around the paddock. Which drivers are going to switch teams, which teams are going to switch cars, and who will be the front runner?  With a major restructuring in the rules requiring exactly 2 idiots per team, several teams are expected to dissolve and reform under new or modified names. All of these questions and uncertainties will be cleared up shortly, but as of now, here’s what we know.
The first rumor is down at ARC Send It! Where defending drivers champion Lieutenant Dan appears to have a new teammate. With Erco expected to have left for greener pastures during the offseason, the team apparently has reached out and secured a deal with Void for season 3. While there was some uncertainty in the paddock over whether the team was going to drop Ferrari in favor of Porsche, sources tell us the team is happy with the 488 GTE.
Next up is Bonglyfe Racing, where series veteran and season 1 champion Zebrazzz has retired over the offseason. DC5R and his Porsche 911 RSR is expected to stay, hoping to build off the success of last season. The other seat at the team is still unknown, but some of the murmurs in the paddock seem to believe that new guy Malgho will be filling the spot. All we do know is the team is expected to put up good results regardless of lineup.
The last hot development is the possibility of a new team in the paddock comprised of veteran drivers. Expected to run full-time in season 3, this BMW M8 powered team hopes to put up big numbers with a stellar lineup. Though no confirmation as of yet, all sources point to Erco and Jean piloting this hot upstart of a team. 
That’s all we have for now, be sure to check back in for the confirmation of all of these rumors!
-LsnfxfsQuQPPIHQ2k8X.title: The Pre-Season Rumor Mill

-Lsu0ZLn5f_rqf2LII1G.author: Vince Belch
-Lsu0ZLn5f_rqf2LII1G.content: The current J2iCS roster completed two full practice races tonight at Weathertech Raceway Laguna Seca.  This marks the first official J2iCS sanctioned (non-points) race on iRacing.  Lieutenant Dan had a commanding victory in race one and while there were a few incidents in race two, Dan once again took the W. Driver's have been asked by the Comite De Competicion to submit feedback on the racing format for the regular season.  The next test race is coming up at an oval sometime soon.
-Lsu0ZLn5f_rqf2LII1G.title: Pre-Season Testing at Laguna Seca

-Lu-AWyXegupA85ReMWW.author: Vince Belch
-Lu-AWyXegupA85ReMWW.content: If you've been directed here from Reddit, Facebook, Instagram, or any other official J2iCS recruitment site, welcome! To join, please email just2idiotscs@gmail.com! We'll on-board you officially to our roster and send you all the details.
-Lu-AWyXegupA85ReMWW.title: Join the J2iCS!

-LwQEcHpVx4QdYyJJDVu.author: Vince Belch
-LwQEcHpVx4QdYyJJDVu.content: Nine J2iCS drivers raced around USA Speedway for the final test races before the season begins.  During the regular season, USA Speedway is the only event during the season that will run two races. Rocky and Nick showed a lot of speed in both races, but multiple cautions slowed the pace down and kept the pack closer together.  In the second race after a rear adjustment, Water Cooler Dale, showed some speed as well and finished in 3rd. Overall, testing of iRacing penalty system was a success as well as multiple drivers expressing how much fun short-track racing is in the GTE cars. We'll see you in January for the first race of the season!
-LwQEcHpVx4QdYyJJDVu.title: Final Test Race at USA

-Lyh4wKcpiYzuUEpYiN_.author: Vince Belch
-Lyh4wKcpiYzuUEpYiN_.content: J2iCS will be competing for one of the top prizes in all of emotorsports this weekend.  Three J2iCS teams will take the field this Saturday to attempt for the victory at Daytona. The teams have been dubbed Scuderia RaceyMcRaceface and each have their own color distinguishing them apart; Green, Purple, and Red.  Green will be lead by Erco in the Porsche 911 RSR with co-drivers, Rocky, Vulon, and vetern J2iCS driver, DC5R. Purple will be lead by last season's champion, Lt. Dan in the Ferrari 488 with co-driver's Void, who is looking to go hard for the championship this season, and the fast rookie, Brando. Red will be lead by Massachusett's very own RTupps.  Co-drivers on Red are all rookies to the J2iCS including Friisky, Ajenson118, and all the way from India, Ankit.  It all begins on the 18th at 8:00 AM EST.  Info on streams and live race updates will be posted on Instagram: @just2idiotscupseries
-Lyh4wKcpiYzuUEpYiN_.title: J2iCS represented in the 24hrs of iRacing (I mean Daytona)

-Lyr6VncVarsx8-2SHhY.author: Vince Belch
-Lyr6VncVarsx8-2SHhY.content: All three J2iCS teams took to the track for final practice before the 24hrs of Daytona on iRacing.
-Lyr6VncVarsx8-2SHhY.title: Raceday is Nearly Here
